title: copyto/moveto puts files in a sub directory of the working directory on windows
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
copyto/moveto puts files in a sub directory of the working directory on windows.

E.G.  If the pwd is "C:\Users\JD", and I run:
rclone copyto "GDrive:Path/To/File.exe" "C:\Path\To\New_File.ext"

The file will end up in: "C:\Users\JD\Path\To\New_File.ext"

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
1.42

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Windows Server 2012 R2, 64 bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive (but problem seems to be on windows side)

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone copyto "GDrive:Doctor Who/Doctor Who (2005)/Season 01/Episode 01/DVD.480.mkv" "C:\PMM\Downloads\Film\TV Shows\Doctor Who (2005)\Season 01\Doctor Who (2005) - s01e01 - Rose.mkv" -vv

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
2018/06/17 18:03:14 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42" starting with parameters ["C:\\Windows\\system32\\rclone.exe" "copyt
o" "GDrive:Doctor Who/Doctor Who (2005)/Season 01/Episode 01/DVD.480.mkv" "C:\\PMM\\Downloads\\Film\\TV Shows\\Doctor Wh
o (2005)\\Season 01\\Doctor Who (2005) - s01e01 - Rose.mkv" "-vv"]
2018/06/17 18:03:14 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\jd\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2018/06/17 18:03:20 INFO  : Local file system at \\?\C:\Users\jd: Modify window is 1ms
2018/06/17 18:03:20 DEBUG : DVD.480.mkv: Couldn't find file - need to transfer
2018/06/17 18:03:50 INFO  : DVD.480.mkv: Copied (new)
2018/06/17 18:03:50 INFO  :
Transferred:   1.802 GBytes (52.034 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:       35.4s

2018/06/17 18:03:50 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
2018/06/17 18:03:50 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42" finishing with parameters ["C:\\Windows\\system32\\rclone.exe" "copy
to" "GDrive:Doctor Who/Doctor Who (2005)/Season 01/Episode 01/DVD.480.mkv" "C:\\PMM\\Downloads\\Film\\TV Shows\\Doctor W
ho (2005)\\Season 01\\Doctor Who (2005) - s01e01 - Rose.mkv" "-vv"]

Even though it says the file was in "C:\PMM\...", it landed again in "C:\Users\jd\PMM\..."
